title: Bug 129561HCGBIDI: Undesirable generation of SQL query elements
description: Bug 129561HCGBIDI: Undesirable generation of SQL query elements This is not even NLS specific defect. Otherwise the query will fail.1. Create a table with a name that includes a blank space in this database. Select 'Preview Results'. Result: Exception is thrown. 7. 'Table Name'. 'Column Name'8.
OB: The issue occurs regardless of the language. The problem is that in the Query screen of the Edit Data Set dialog, when dragging and dropping columns into the Query screen, every entity name, including those with blank spaces, must be enclosed in quotation marks. Select 'Preview Results'. Result: No exception is thrown.
EB: When creating a DB2 database, make sure it includes a column with a name that includes a blank space. Create a Data Source based on the DB from step 1. Create a Data Set based on the table from Step 2. On the Query screen, drag and drop the column name from step 2 into the SELECT portion of the clause. Manually change the SQL query as follows: SELECT USER.
SR: The steps to reproduce the bug are as follows: 1. Create a DB2 database. 2. Make sure it has a column with a name that includes a blank space. 3. Create a Data Source based on the DB from step 1. 4. Create a Data Set based on the table from Step 2. 5. On the Query screen, drag and drop the column name from step 2 into the SELECT portion of the clause. 6. Manually change the SQL query as follows: SELECT USER.
